main_definition: Feeling or showing approval or support, often to motivate someone.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give support and confidence to someone
meanings_and_examples.example: His words of encouragement helped her finish the marathon.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Prompted or instigated by something positive
meanings_and_examples.example: The constructive feedback from my teacher was encouraging towards my writing skills.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having a belief that someone can achieve their goals based on past successes
meanings_and_examples.example: After her first successful painting exhibition, she felt very encouraged to pursue art more seriously.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Feeling uplifted or inspired by an event or situation
meanings_and_examples.example: The community's resilience in the face of adversity was very encouraging and inspiring.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To urge someone to take a particular action with confidence in their ability
meanings_and_examples.example: I am encouraged to apply for this job because I have all the necessary qualifications.
